learning_objective: Modify, remix, or incorporate portions of an existing program into one's own work, to develop something new or add more advanced features.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is a budding farmer who is studying about soil fertility. They want to develop a program that classifies the fertility level of soil based on the amount of Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Potassium present in the soil sample. A soil is classified as 'fertile' if it has at least 15 units of Nitrogen, 10 units of Phosphorus and 5 units of Potassium. Otherwise, it is classified as 'infertile'. They have written a partial program to achieve this. Can you identify the missing code snippet that should replace TODO to correctly implement the classifications?",
    "Answer1": "if nitrogen >= 15 and phosphorus >= 10 and potassium >= 5
	output "Soil is fertile"
else
	output "Soil is infertile"",
    "Answer2": "if nitrogen > 15 or phosphorus > 10 or potassium > 5
	output "Soil is fertile"
else
	output "Soil is infertile"",
    "Answer3": "if nitrogen > 15 and phosphorus > 10 and potassium > 5
	output "Soil is fertile"
else
	output "Soil is infertile"",
    "Answer4": "if nitrogen >= 15 or phosphorus >= 10 or potassium >= 5
	output "Soil is fertile"
else
	output "Soil is infertile"",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The fertility of soil is classified based on all three nutrients - Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Potassium. It is considered 'fertile' only if it has at least 15 units of Nitrogen, 10 units of Phosphorus and 5 units of Potassium. Thus, the condition should be a logical 'and' with '>=', not '>'.",

end"
